meanings.definition: To discover or locate something by searching.
meanings.sent1: I always outfind my missing socks under the bed.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outfind the hidden treasure in the old cave.
meanings.sent3: Trying to outfind a needle in a haystack can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outfind the truth was like a beacon guiding her way.
meanings.sent5: The detective's ability to outfind clues was unmatched.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in finding or discovering something.
meanings.sent1: He will outfind all his competitors in the scavenger hunt.
meanings.sent2: The explorer aimed to outfind all previous archaeological discoveries.
meanings.sent3: In the race to outfind the rare flower, everyone was sprinting.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for outfinding unique solutions made her stand out.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's drive to outfind new species was truly inspiring.
